title: Interview this afternoon on Belgian national radio
content:
Just a quick note to any Dutch-speaking Typophiles who might be interested. I'm being interviewed this afternoon between 3 and 4 pm for [Neon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019084846/http:/www.radio1.be/radio1_master/programmas/neo/r1_neo_home/index.html), a program on [Radio 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019084846/http:/www.radio1.be/) (Belgian national radio), about 50 years of Helvetica.

I hope I don't screw up! :^P

BTW I'll be proudly wearing my "Who needs Helvetica?" Hattenbach T-shirt. Figures...
author: Bald Condensed

comments.content: Congrats, Yves! Is it a call in show? I'll dial in and throw a soft ball question.
Hahahahaha, you wish! My main concern is that in preparation of the interview I already talked for a full hour with the editor, and I only have like 10 minutes.

Yves and Helvetica! The battle of the giants!  
I have 3 hours to learn Dutch ;^)

Congrats Yves (and thanks for the amazing 007 postcard).

Dino

Sounds like a Dutch treat!

ChrisL
I recorded the thing and an MP3-file wil be uploaded on the [Magelaan](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019084846/http:/www.magelaan.be/nieuws.html) website by next week.
Well, I basically recount the history of Helvetica and try to explain why it has become so inevitable that it warranted the making of a documentary.

Were you eating Helveeta while taping the show?

ChrisL
